items.title: What we know so far about the alleged Bondi Beach gunmen
items.summary: While a motive is still unclear, police have revealed fresh details about the pair who unleashed an attack at Bondi Beach in what has been declared a terrorist incident.

items.title: Mary gave birth to her son in Australia. But he has no valid legal status
items.summary: There's a growing number of undocumented children in regional Australia, born to disengaged migrant workers who have no visa.

items.title: Wanted in Hong Kong, now this China critic's wife is being targeted in Australia
items.summary: Ted Hui, who lives in Australia in exile from Hong Kong, described the incident targeting his wife as "immoral".

items.title: 'An attack on one is an attack on all': Communities united in grief after Bondi terror attack
items.summary: Faith and community leaders have urged calm, compassion and solidarity in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: 'Now it's almost embarrassing': Americans on living in Australia under Trump 2.0
items.summary: As interest in US politics surges and Australians' views shift for the worse, Americans reflect on what it's like to be an expat down under.

items.title: Why Sara and Issam still can't go to Cronulla beach 20 years after the riots
items.summary: Australia's racial discrimination commissioner is warning that the factors that fomented the Cronulla riots are still in play today - and that a similar racial brawl could occur again.

items.title: What we know so far as NSW Police declare Bondi shooting terrorist incident
items.summary: At least 16 people have been killed after gunmen opened fire at a crowd at Bondi Beach with footage showing a man disarming one of the gunmen.

items.title: 'Act of evil antisemitism': Terrorist incident declared after 12 killed in Bondi Beach shooting — as it happened
items.summary: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said the "evil that was unleashed at Bondi Beach" was "beyond comprehension".

items.title: Paleo diets sell the idea of 'eating like our ancestors'. Here's what they actually ate
items.summary: A new study by Australian and Canadian archaeologists proves what our ancestors really ate: everything.

items.title: 'He took all my wages': How visa rules can expose migrant women to family violence
items.summary: A Thai woman's harrowing story shows how migrant women are vulnerable to particular forms of family violence.

items.title: Attorney-General Michelle Rowland to repay 2023 family trip as expenses scandal grows
items.summary: The treasurer on Sunday rejected calls for Rowland to resign amid growing scrutiny on politician's spending.

items.title: Supermarket giants face $10 million fines over price gouging
items.summary: Shoppers have been promised a fairer price at the checkout under laws to crack down on purported price-gouging by major supermarkets.

items.title: 'Deeply disturbed': Angry fans vandalise stadium as Messi's India tour turns into chaos
items.summary: State chief minister Mamata Banerjee said she was "disturbed" and "shocked" at the mismanagement.

items.title: Two US soldiers and an interpreter killed in Syria ambush attack
items.summary: Donald Trump has vowed to inflict "very serious retaliation" after an Islamic State ambush in Syria that killed three Americans.

items.title: Wikie and Keijo's marine park has shut down. Now the race is on to find them a new home
items.summary: Marine parks around the world have closed their doors in the wake of laws to address cruelty concerns. What about the animals left behind?

items.title: St Kilda penguins 'weird' ticketing system forces visitors into months-long wait
items.summary: St Kilda's penguin-viewing ticket system is frustrating visitors, as spots fill up fast and no-shows leave gaps, prompting calls for improvements.

items.title: Tom Silvagni can now be named in the press. How do suppression orders work?
items.summary: Once known as a 'high-profile' man guilty of two counts of rape, the media can now report Silvagni's name.

items.title: 'Leaving isn't an option': A Palestinian Australian winemaker's fight for his land
items.summary: Life for Palestinian farmers living in the West Bank has become fraught, with rising attacks on crops and property by settlers.

items.title: 12,000 lives changed: How a workshop is helping the most vulnerable with unwanted bikes
items.summary: From abandoned bikes to functioning wheelchairs, a Gold Coast-based workshop is creating new possibilities for people with mobility challenges.

items.title: Thailand vows to keep fighting at Thai-Cambodian border until threats end
items.summary: A ceasefire was signed in October, but border clashes between the Southeast Asian countries have reignited in recent days.

items.title: 'Hopeful for the future': Celebrations kick off as Victorian Treaty becomes law
items.summary: First Nations people have welcomed the formal start of Victoria’s landmark Treaty, marked by a public concert in Melbourne.

items.title: 'He's still the go-to': The Australian who's still counting our COVID cases
items.summary: Meet the Melbourne IT specialist who tracks "incredibly valuable" COVID-19 data in his spare time.

items.title: Amnesty International finds Hamas committed crimes against humanity on October 7
items.summary: As part of its investigation, Amnesty interviewed 70 people, including survivors and victims' families, and visited some attack sites.

items.title: 'Personal blessing': King Charles reveals cancer treatment can be scaled back
items.summary: Charles, 77, had been receiving treatment after he was diagnosed with an unspecified form of cancer last year.
